00015 #ifndef __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NYSTROEM_METHOD_HPP
00016 #define __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NYSTROEM_METHOD_HPP
00017 
00018 #include <mlpack/core.hpp>
00019 #include <mlpack/methods/nystroem_method/kmeans_selection.hpp>
00020 #include <mlpack/methods/nystroem_method/nystroem_method.hpp>
00021 
00022 namespace mlpack {
00023 namespace kpca {
00024 
00025 template<
00026   typename KernelType,
00027   typename PointSelectionPolicy = kernel::KMeansSelection<> 
00028 >
00029 class NystroemKernelRule
00030 {
00031   public:
00042     static void ApplyKernelMatrix(const arma::mat& data,
00043                                   arma::mat& transformedData,
00044                                   arma::vec& eigval,
00045                                   arma::mat& eigvec,
00046                                   const size_t rank,
00047                                   KernelType kernel = KernelType())
00048     {
00049       arma::mat G, v;
00050       kernel::NystroemMethod<KernelType, PointSelectionPolicy> nm(data, kernel,
00051                                                         rank);
00052       nm.Apply(G);
00053       transformedData = G.t() * G;
00054 
00055       // For PCA the data has to be centered, even if the data is centered. But
00056       // it is not guaranteed that the data, when mapped to the kernel space, is
00057       // also centered. Since we actually never work in the feature space we 
00058       // cannot center the data. So, we perform a "psuedo-centering" using the
00059       // kernel matrix.
00060       arma::rowvec rowMean = arma::sum(transformedData, 0) / 
00061           transformedData.n_cols;
00062       transformedData.each_col() -= arma::sum(transformedData, 1) /
00063           transformedData.n_cols;
00064       transformedData.each_row() -= rowMean;
00065       transformedData += arma::sum(rowMean) / transformedData.n_cols;
00066 
00067       // Eigendecompose the centered kernel matrix.
00068       arma::svd(eigvec, eigval, v, transformedData);
00069       eigval %= eigval / (data.n_cols - 1);
00070 
00071       transformedData = eigvec.t() * G.t();
00072     }
00073 };
00074 
00075 }; // namespace kpca
00076 }; // namespace mlpack
00077 
00078 #endif
